author: Deleted User
content: It seems to me that greater scaling is achieved when utility tokens stop being a thing and ETH is just used for the incentives and fees because the utility tokens create demand for decentralized exchanges and this exchanging activity is whats causing a high consumption of blockspace. I imagine this problem will sort itself over time tho and scaling solutions and dapps that use ETH will win in terms of actual users over those that have their own tokens. But lets see

author: codeknight
content: The challenge with using Eth only for a dapp is governance and raising money. If you are just using Eth, then your governance is likely centralized and you will probably need offchain funding for development.

author: codeknight
content: Notably, Uniswap was basically using the model you suggest and Sushiswap was able to take a lot of liquidity from it.

author: protolambda
content: Sometimes we use it for signaling on discord messages that a team has ACK'ed something (you can expand the message to see who exactly added the emojis, so no fakes), but it's mostly just for fun.

author: potuz
content:
I was wandering if some knowledgeable and generous soul could pin some messages on channels with background material on the channel. This does not seem to be against the spirit of the server outlined in #welcome and it would be beneficial at to some. Some channels that I'd be interested for example are #polynomial-commitments #state-expiry #verkle-trie-migration  that don't have pinned messages. For example a link to Kate, et. al. *Constant-Size Commitments to Polynomials and
Their Applications* would be nice in #polynomial-commitments , what else?

author: potuz
content: correction: in the desktop version the header might contain a useful, link, so does <#739145593762611250> for example
